get.description: Know Africa's Homepage

post.description: This allows a user sign up on Know Africa.

409.description: Username/Email already used by another user.

post.description: This allows a registered user to sign in.

get.description: This verifies a registered user.

post.description: This allows a registered user recover their password.

404.description: Email address not associated with any account.

post.description: This allows a registered user reset their password.

404.description: Email address not associated with any account.

patch.description: This allows a signed in user to update their profile.

post.description: This allows an Admin user create a newsletter.
This allows a user to subscribe to the newsletter.

409.description: User is already subscribed to this newsletter.

get.description: Verifies that the user has been subscribed.
This returns an array of all subscribers.
This allows a user to unsubscribe.

post.description: This allows an admin user to add a new country.

GetCountryById.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /api/v1/country/{id}`, `PATCH /api/v1/admin/country/{id}` and `DELETE /api/v1/admin/country/{id}`.

get.description: This allows a user to retrieve a country by it's ID.
This allows a user to retrieve all countries.

patch.description: This allows an admin user to update a country's details by it's ID.

delete.description: This allows an admin user delete a country.

post.description: This allows an admin user to add a new state to a country.

GetStateById.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /api/v1/state/{id}`, `PATCH /api/v1/state/{id}` and `DELETE /api/v1/state/{id}`.

get.description: This allows a user to retrieve a state by it's ID.
This allows a user to retrieve all states.

patch.description: This allows an admin user to update a state's details.

delete.description: This allows an admin user to delete a state.

post.description: This allows an admin user to add a new tourist center.

id.description: ID of the created tourist center.

GetTouristCenterById.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /api/v1/tourist-center/{id}`, `PATCH /api/v1/tourist-center/{id}` and `DELETE /api/v1/tourist-center/{id}`.

409.description: Tourist center already exists in database.

get.description: This allows all users to retrieve a tourist center by it's ID.
This allows all users to retrieve all tourist centers.

patch.description: This allows an admin user to delete a tourist center.

delete.description: This allows an admin user to delete a tourist center.

post.description: This allows an admin user to add new music.

GetMusicById.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /api/v1/music/{id}`, `PATCH /api/v1/music/{id}` and `DELETE /api/v1/music/{id}`.

get.description: This allows all users retrieve music by ID.
This allows all users to retrieve all music.

patch.description: This allows an admin user to update music.

delete.description: This allows an admin user to delete music.

post.description: This allows an Admin user create an ethnic group.

0.value:
{
   "name": "Igbo",
   "festivals": "New Yam Festival",
   "dressing": "In the old days, some Igbo women celebrated their feast in ekwerike clothing. In other words, they tied thick fabric around their waist. Others preferred painting their bodies with ufle, nzu, edo, uri and other colored ornaments (instead of wearing clothing) and decorating their waist with bead accessories.",
   "language": "Igbo",
   "gallery": "https://unsplash.com/photos/eS_aZA5S42Y"
   "culturalPractices": "The Igbo people have a traditional religious belief that there is one creator, called ‘Chineke’ or ‘Chukwu’. The creator can be approached through many other deities and spirits in the form of natural objects, most commonly through the god of thunder called ‘Amadioha’."
}
